resources.string: Ignore location requests from this number
This field must start with a country code (\"+xx\")
This number is already in the list!
Your contacts app didn\'t return a number. Either use a different contacts app or manually enter the contact\'s details.
The number entered does not include a country code. A country code should be included to help match the numbers of incoming SMSs, especially when travelling internationally.
Would you like to replace the number with\n\t%1$s ?
Based on Anevero\'s project (which is based on Warren Bank\'s project)
Just add a number and a message to which the app should reply. When your phone gets an SMS message from this number the app will send the phone\'s location in reply.
The app isn\'t sending out my location after receiving a correct message. What\'s happening?

Firstly, double check that the number and the message prefix in the app match the message. Possibly check this again. If you\'re sure they match, it may be that you received an RCS message, rather than an SMS. Sadly, SMS my GPS doesn\'t currently respond to RCS messages. Read the FAQ question regarding RCS messages, below, for a workaround.
How can I send SMSs if my phone uses RCS messaging?

Many modern phones use the RCS messaging standard to send messages. These messages don\'t trigger SMS my GPS\'s response. To help with this, it is possible to send an SMS location request from within the app: from the main screen press the button with target\-like icon to send an SMS to the number indicated, with the message saved for that number.\n\nIf your contact needs to send you an SMS location\-request but can\'t, they will need to download this app, also. Then they can use the target button to send you an SMS after adding your details to their app.
Why does this app not work in the background?

Due to Android restrictions, we can\'t guarantee that app will be able to always work in background. Ensure that this app is allowed to run in background (Settings - Apps). Disable battery saver mode.
Why does this app not send the last known location?

The app can send last known location only if the system can provide it. If Android can\'t provide the last known location (for example, because you had GPS disabled for a long time), the app won\'t send it.
How does this app use location permission?
The app uses it to get the location after receiving an appropriate incoming SMS.
How does this app use SMS permission?
The app reads all the incoming SMS to check if it needs to send location as a reply. It doesn\'t store or process your SMS messages in any other way.
How does this app use contacts permission?
This permission is not necessary. You can provide it to use contact picker when creating a new item. If you don\'t provide it, you still will be able to enter the number manually.
This app doesn\'t collect any data. Google Location services may be used for location requests. Their use is regulated by Google Privacy Policy.
Uses different sensors (including GPS) to get quite accurate location in several tens of seconds.
Last known location can be sent almost immediately (if available) but can be quite outdated.
Sometimes GPS module can provide a more accurate location than Google Location Services (but it can take up to several minutes).
Gets the last known location using only the GPS sensor.
Uses cellular and nearest WiFi networks to determine the location. Can be less accurate than GPS but is faster.
Gets the last known location using only the network info.
If the service is enabled it will start automatically after system restart.
